### <a name="sasl"></a>`sasl`

A description of what this class does

#### Examples

##### 

```puppet
include sasl
```

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `sasl` class:

* [`package`](#-sasl--package)

##### <a name="-sasl--package"></a>`package`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

Default 'sasl2-bin'

Default value: `undef`

### <a name="sasl--applications"></a>`sasl::applications`

A description of what this class does

#### Examples

##### 

```puppet
class { 'sasl::applications':
  applications => {
    slapd => {
      mech_list => ['gssapi', 'plain', 'external'],
      pwcheck_method: 'saslauthd',
    },
  },
}
```

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `sasl::applications` class:

* [`applications`](#-sasl--applications--applications)

##### <a name="-sasl--applications--applications"></a>`applications`

Data type: `Hash`

Hash that contain the application configuration

Default value: `{}`

### <a name="sasl--configs"></a>`sasl::configs`

A description of what this class does

#### Examples

##### 

```puppet
class { 'sasl::configs':
  config => {
    'saslauthd' => {
      socket => '/var/run/saslauthd',
      config => '/etc/default/saslauthd',
    },
  },
}
```

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `sasl::configs` class:

* [`config`](#-sasl--configs--config)

##### <a name="-sasl--configs--config"></a>`config`

Data type: `Hash`

Hash that contain saslauthd daemon configuration

Default value: `undef`

### <a name="sasl--service"></a>`sasl::service`

A description of what this class does

#### Examples

##### 

```puppet
include sasl::services
```

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `sasl::service` class:

* [`service`](#-sasl--service--service)
* [`package`](#-sasl--service--package)
* [`mechanism`](#-sasl--service--mechanism)
* [`mech_options`](#-sasl--service--mech_options)
* [`threads`](#-sasl--service--threads)
* [`options`](#-sasl--service--options)
* [`socket`](#-sasl--service--socket)
* [`config`](#-sasl--service--config)

##### <a name="-sasl--service--service"></a>`service`

Data type: `String`

Service name os the saslauthd daemon
Default 'saslauthd'

Default value: `'saslauthd'`

##### <a name="-sasl--service--package"></a>`package`

Data type: `String`

Default 'sasl2-bin'

Default value: `'sasl2-bin'`

##### <a name="-sasl--service--mechanism"></a>`mechanism`

Data type: `Sasl::Mechanism`

Backend for saslauth service
Default 'ldap'

Default value: `'ldap'`

##### <a name="-sasl--service--mech_options"></a>`mech_options`

Data type: `String`

Additionaly -O option to sasl2-bin

Default value: `''`

##### <a name="-sasl--service--threads"></a>`threads`

Data type: `Integer`

Number of process running
Default 5

Default value: `5`

##### <a name="-sasl--service--options"></a>`options`

Data type: `Array[String]`

Other extra options to pass to sasl2-bin
Default ['-c']

Default value: `['-c']`

##### <a name="-sasl--service--socket"></a>`socket`

Data type: `Stdlib::Absolutepath`

Socket path used by daemon

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-sasl--service--config"></a>`config`

Data type: `Stdlib::Absolutepath`

Config file to store env used by daemon

Default value: `undef`

### <a name="sasl--application"></a>`sasl::application`

A description of what this defined type does

#### Examples

##### 

```puppet
sasl::application { 'slapd':
  mech_list => ['gssapi', 'plain', 'external'],
  pwcheck_method: 'saslauthd',
}
```

##### <a name="-sasl--application--application_file"></a>`application_file`

Data type: `Stdlib::Absolutepath`

file to save apllication specific configuration
Default "/usr/lib/sasl2/${name}.conf",

Default value: `"/usr/lib/sasl2/${name}.conf"`

##### <a name="-sasl--application--authdaemon_path"></a>`authdaemon_path`

Data type: `Optional[Stdlib::Absolutepath]`

Path to Courier-IMAP authdaemond’s unix socket.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-sasl--application--auto_transition"></a>`auto_transition`

Data type: `Optional[Enum['yes','noplain','no']]`

When set to ‘yes’ or ‘noplain’, and when using an auxprop plugin, automatically transition users to other mechs when they do a
successful plaintext authentication. When set to ‘noplain’, only non-plaintext secrets will be written. Note that the only mechanisms
(as currently implemented) which don’t use plaintext secrets are OTP, SCRAM and SRP.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-sasl--application--canon_user_plugin"></a>`canon_user_plugin`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

Name of canon_user plugin to use

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-sasl--application--log_level"></a>`log_level`

Data type: `Optional[Integer]`

Numeric Logging Level (see SASL_LOG_* in sasl.h for values and descriptions)

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-sasl--application--mech_list"></a>`mech_list`

Data type: `Optional[Array[String]]`

Whitespace separated list of mechanisms to allow (e.g. ‘plain otp’). Used to restrict the mechanisms to a subset of the installed
plugins.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-sasl--application--plugin_list"></a>`plugin_list`

Data type: `Optional[Stdlib::Absolutepath]`

Location of Plugin list (Unsupported)

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-sasl--application--pwcheck_method"></a>`pwcheck_method`

Data type: `Enum['auxprop','saslauthd','pwcheck','authdaemond','alwaystrue']`

Whitespace separated list of mechanisms used to verify passwords, used by sasl_checkpass. Possible values: ‘auxprop’, ‘saslauthd’,
‘pwcheck’, ‘authdaemond’ [if compiled with –with-authdaemond]) and ‘alwaystrue’ [if compiled with –enable-alwaystrue])

Default value: `'auxprop'`

##### <a name="-sasl--application--saslauthd_path"></a>`saslauthd_path`

Data type: `Optional[Stdlib::Absolutepath]`

Path to saslauthd run directory (including the “/mux” named pipe)

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-sasl--application--auxprop_plugin"></a>`auxprop_plugin`

Data type: `Optional[Array[Variant[Enum['gssapi','ldapdb','otp','sasldb','sql','srp','kerberosv4'],String]]]`

Name of auxiliary plugin to use, you may specify a space-separated list of plugin names, and the plugins will be queried in order.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-sasl--application--keytab"></a>`keytab`

Data type: `Optional[Stdlib::Absolutepath]`

Location of keytab file

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-sasl--application--ccache_store"></a>`ccache_store`

Data type: `Optional[Stdlib::Absolutepath]`

Location where cached credentials are stored, For example this could be FILE:/path/to/credstore/krb5cc_%U. Formatting options are:
%u UID of the logged in user (only valid for existing UNIX users) %U username of the logged in user %e EUID of the executing process
user %E username of the executing process user %p PID process ID of the executing process
Note that not all formatting options may not be available for all target environments. See the log files for indications in run-time.
If this option can not be parsed correctly credentials cache will fall-back to the contents of the KRB5CCNAME environment variable.
If this option is omitted, credentials delegation will not be enabled.
See MIT Kerberos documentation on more information about credentials cache storage.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-sasl--application--ad_compat"></a>`ad_compat`

Data type: `Optional[Stdlib::Yes_no]`

When set to ‘yes’, ‘on’, ‘1’ or ‘true’, a client will request both confidentiality and integrity when required by Active Directory.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-sasl--application--service_principal"></a>`service_principal`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

Service principal to use when accepting a connection as a server. The principal name must be in GSS_C_NT_HOSTBASED_SERVICE form,
e.g. “someservice@someinstance” or “someservice”, or the string “*”, which causes the server to accept any valid principal present
in its keytab.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-sasl--application--ldapdb_uri"></a>`ldapdb_uri`

Data type: `Optional[Array[URI]]`

URI to the LDAP server. You can specify a space-separated list of URIs - ldapi:// or ldaps://ldap1/ ldaps://ldap2/

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-sasl--application--ldapdb_id"></a>`ldapdb_id`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

ldap SASL authentication id

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-sasl--application--ldapdb_mech"></a>`ldapdb_mech`

Data type: `Optional[Variant[Array[String],String]]`

LDAP SASL mechanism for authentication.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-sasl--application--ldapdb_pw"></a>`ldapdb_pw`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

LDAP password for SASL authentication id

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-sasl--application--ldapdb_rc"></a>`ldapdb_rc`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

The filename specified here will be put into the server’s LDAPRC environment variable, and libldap-specific config options may be set
in that ldaprc file.
The main purpose behind this option is to allow a client TLS certificate to be configured, so that SASL/EXTERNAL may be used between
the SASL server and the LDAP server. This is the most optimal way to use this plugin when the servers are on separate machines.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-sasl--application--ldapdb_starttls"></a>`ldapdb_starttls`

Data type: `Optional[Enum['try','demand']]`

Use StartTLS. This option may be set to ‘try’ or ‘demand’. When set to “try” any failure in StartTLS is ignored. When set to “demand”
then any failure aborts the connection.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-sasl--application--ldapdb_canon_attr"></a>`ldapdb_canon_attr`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

Use the value of the specified attribute as the user’s canonical name. The attribute will be looked up in the user’s LDAP entry. This
setting must be configured in order to use LDAPDB as a canonuser plugin.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-sasl--application--opiekeys"></a>`opiekeys`

Data type: `Optional[Stdlib::Absolutepath]`

Location of the opiekeys file

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-sasl--application--otp_mda"></a>`otp_mda`

Data type: `Optional[Enum['md4','md5','sha1']]`

(Without opie) Message digest algorithm for one-time passwords, used by sasl_setpass

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-sasl--application--sasldb_path"></a>`sasldb_path`

Data type: `Optional[Stdlib::Absolutepath]`

Path to sasldb file

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-sasl--application--sasldb_mapsize"></a>`sasldb_mapsize`

Data type: `Optional[Integer]`

For sasldb with LMDB. Size of the memory map used by the DB. This is also the maximum possible size of the database, so it must be set
to a value large enough to contain all the desired user records.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-sasl--application--sasldb_maxreaders"></a>`sasldb_maxreaders`

Data type: `Optional[Integer]`

For sasldb with LMDB. Maximum number of threads (or processes) that may concurrently read the database.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-sasl--application--sql_engine"></a>`sql_engine`

Data type: `Optional[Enum['mysql','pgsql','sqlite','sqlite3']]`

Name of SQL engine to use (possible values: ‘mysql’, ‘pgsql’, ‘sqlite’, ‘sqlite3’).

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-sasl--application--sql_hostnames"></a>`sql_hostnames`

Data type: `Optional[Array[URI]]`

Comma separated list of SQL servers (in host[:port] format).

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-sasl--application--sql_user"></a>`sql_user`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

Username to use for authentication to the SQL server.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-sasl--application--sql_passwd"></a>`sql_passwd`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

Password to use for authentication to the SQL server.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-sasl--application--sql_database"></a>`sql_database`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

Name of the database which contains the auxiliary properties.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-sasl--application--sql_select"></a>`sql_select`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

SELECT statement to use for fetching properties. This option is required in order to use the SQL plugin.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-sasl--application--sql_insert"></a>`sql_insert`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

INSERT statement to use for creating properties for new users.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-sasl--application--sql_update"></a>`sql_update`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

UPDATE statement to use for modifying properties.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-sasl--application--srp_mda"></a>`srp_mda`

Data type: `Optional[Enum['md5','sha1','smd160']]`

Message digest algorithm for SRP calculations

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-sasl--application--srvtab"></a>`srvtab`

Data type: `Optional[Stdlib::Absolutepath]`

Location of the srvtab file

Default value: `undef`

### <a name="sasl--config"></a>`sasl::config`

A description of what this defined type does

#### Examples

##### 

```puppet
sasl::config { 'saslauthd':
  socket => '/var/run/saslauthd',
  config => '/etc/default/saslauthd',
}
```

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `sasl::config` defined type:

* [`mechanism`](#-sasl--config--mechanism)
* [`mech_options`](#-sasl--config--mech_options)
* [`threads`](#-sasl--config--threads)
* [`options`](#-sasl--config--options)
* [`socket`](#-sasl--config--socket)
* [`config`](#-sasl--config--config)

##### <a name="-sasl--config--mechanism"></a>`mechanism`

Data type: `Sasl::Mechanism`

Backend for saslauth service
Default 'ldap'

Default value: `'ldap'`

##### <a name="-sasl--config--mech_options"></a>`mech_options`

Data type: `String`

Additionaly -O option to sasl2-bin

Default value: `''`

##### <a name="-sasl--config--threads"></a>`threads`

Data type: `Integer`

Number of process running
Default 5

Default value: `5`

##### <a name="-sasl--config--options"></a>`options`

Data type: `Array[String]`

Other extra options to pass to sasl2-bin
Default ['-c']

Default value: `['-c']`

##### <a name="-sasl--config--socket"></a>`socket`

Data type: `Stdlib::Absolutepath`

Socket path used by daemon

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-sasl--config--config"></a>`config`

Data type: `Stdlib::Absolutepath`

Config file to store env used by daemon

Default value: `$name`

## Data types

### <a name="SASL--Mechanism"></a>`SASL::Mechanism`

The SASL::Mechanism data type.

Alias of `Enum['getpwent', 'httpform', 'kerberos5', 'ldap', 'pam', 'rimap', 'sasldb', 'shadow']`
